newsitem.title: UK: HSBC up after Hong Kong market rally.
newsitem.headline: HSBC up after Hong Kong market rally.

text.p: Shares in HSBC Holdings Plc were up 18-1/2p to 15.72-1/2 stg by 0855 GMT, following a strong performance by shares in the Hong Kong market, market makers said.
"HSBC is up in line with the Hang Seng this morning," one market maker said. "There hasn't been any big buyer yet but considering the(London share) market is weak, it's putting in a good show."
Hong Kong's blue-chip Hang Seng Index was up over 300 points or 2.3 percent by 0855 GMT following news of the death of China's paramount leader Deng Xiaoping.
Dealers in Hong Kong said Deng's death removed the uncertainty overhanging the market during recent sessions.
